Accounts Officer Job at Veritasi Homes & Properties Limited




        
    

        
        Veritasi Homes & Properties Limited is a real estate company that provides marketing, advisory and developmental services across the entire real estate value chain in Nigeria. With special interest in property development, we have an extensive property base that stems from the successful delivery of our maiden developmental project. We ensure that we create the right investment options for myriads of our partners investing in the Nigerian real estate sector.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accounts Officer 

Job Location: Ikoyi, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (On-site)
Reports to: CFO

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a detail-oriented Accounts Officer to manage the day-to-day financial operations and maintain accurate general ledger records for our real estate firm.
	He/She will support both the accounts payable and accounts receivable functions, ensuring strict adherence to internal controls and meeting all reporting deadlines.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain accurate and up-to-date financial records, including processing journal entries and ensuring the integrity of the General Ledger.
	Perform comprehensive and timely reconciliations of all bank statements, vendor accounts, and various general ledger accounts.
	Support both Accounts Payable (invoice verification, processing) and Accounts Receivable (basic invoicing, follow-up) functions to ensure seamless financial operations.
	Assist in the preparation of monthly financial reports, schedules, and working papers, ensuring compliance with established financial procedures and statutory regulations.
	Collaborate with the Finance team to uphold and enforce robust internal financial controls and operational procedures.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Accounting or Finance is mandatory.
	3–5 years of progressive experience in general accounting or finance, preferably within the real estate industry.
	Strong command of financial processes and procedures, and be able to identify and resolve discrepancies or issues related to ledgers and accounts.
	Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel and experience with accounting software is essential.
	Exceptional analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
	Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
	Proven ability to meet strict deadlines and perform accurately under pressure.

title: Job Openings at Nemitt Pharmaceuticals Limited
content:
The company Nemitt Pharmaceuticals Limited is an indigenous pharmaceutical company incorporated in July 1988 as a fully capitalized limited liability company with RC no 116 088 to among other activities, engage in the wholesale of Pharmaceutical products. Nemitt Pharmaceuticals Limited was born out of the dire need for an alternative to the hitherto existing chaotic distribution in the pharmaceutical supply chain. with the goal of addressing the gaps in the distribution value chain.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Sales Assistant

Job Location: Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role
     

            
    




	This role goes beyond just selling .it’s about building lasting relationships with customers, ensuring they get the right products, and delivering an excellent shopping experience every time.
	If you’re energetic, customer-focused, and enjoy working in a fast-paced environment, this opportunity is for you.


What You’ll Be Doing


	Warmly welcome and attend to customers.
	Assist with customers’ purchase lists, picking products, processing invoices, and managing point-of-sale transactions.
	Provide accurate product information and guidance to help customers make informed choices.
	Keep shelves stocked, neat, and well-merchandised.
	Build and maintain strong, long-term relationships with customers.
	Handle inquiries, resolve basic concerns, and escalate issues where necessary.
	Keep accurate records of sales, appointments, and customer feedback.
	Work with the team to ensure smooth operations and follow company policies.


What We’re Looking For


	OND or HND qualification.
	At least 2 years of experience in sales, customer service, pharmacy, or retail.
	Strong communication skills, both verbal and written.
	Good computer literacy and ability to work with sales systems.
	A passion for excellent customer service and attention to detail.
	Must live within or close to Surulere, Ojuelegba, Ijora, Apapa, Mushin, Fadeyi, Yaba or environ.


Why Join Us?


	Salary: N120,000 - N140,000 / month
	This is a chance to work in a supportive team where customer care and professionalism come first.
	Your role directly contributes to our mission of providing quality pharmaceutical products while driving growth for the business.


Application Closing Date: 8th January, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to: Hrnemitt@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Driver

Job Location: Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are looking for a calm driver with experience working in a corporate organisation.
	We are seeking a reliable and experienced Driver to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for providing safe and efficient driving services while ensuring adherence to traffic regulations and company standards.
	Pick up and deliver goods to clients
	Loading and unloading of goods
	Stay up-to-date on road conditions
	Ensure the cleanliness of the vehicle and proper documents
	Schedule regular vehicleservice appointments and report any issues.


Requirements


	Must possess a valid driver’s license
	Must have a valid LASSRA card.
	A polite and professional disposition
	Must have or be conversant with Lagosroads.
	Resides preferably around Surulere, Ikeja, Yaba, or environment
	Proven driving experience within Lagos State is a must
	Good knowledge of Lagos roads, routes, and traffic patterns.
	Must be able to drive manual and automatic
	Ability to ride a bike is advantageous


Salary
N100,000 - N130,000 Monthly. 

Application Closing Date: 31st December, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to: Hrnemitt@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Store Officer

Job Location: Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking men to join our team as Storekeeper / Warehouse Officer who will be responsible for receiving materials incoming from vendors, managing warehouse / store stock, replenishing shop floor stock, and maintaining accurate stock records.


Responsibilities


	Replenish supply inventories following established guidelines of the company
	Maintain a neat, clean and safe working environment as per government regulation
	Manage the store layout
	Receive, upload and shelf supplies
	Perform stock related duties like returning, packing, and labelling
	Inspect delivers for discrepancy or damage
	Report damaged or shortdated inventories for record-keeping and reimbursement
	Rotate stock and dispose of surplus and expired quantities
	Keep an organised allocation of inventory placed in warehouse and store
	Ensure proper completion of documentation of inbound and outbound orders.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess minimum of an ND, HND with 0 - 1 year work experience.
	Age range 25 - 39 years old
	Must be organized and punctual.
	Prior experience in retail would be advantageous.
	Good verbal and written communication skills.
	Physical stamina and ability to lift and move cartons
	Proficient in Microsoft Office.
	Proximity to Ojuelegba is very important (Yaba, Surulere, Aguda, Ajegunle, Apapa, Onipan , Fadeyi and environ).


Salary
N120,000 - N140,000 / month.

Application Closing Date: 30th December, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrnemitt@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only candiddates that meets requirements will be contacted.

     

    

        Click here to Apply
